free_text.Learning outcomes: To provide a comprehensive overview of the most important physical,  chemical,   technical and medical basic concepts of photomedicine.[br/]To learn how to apply photonics to the detection and therapy of lesions like cancer and other non-oncologic conditions associated with vascular or superficial abnormalities.
free_text.Content: 1. Interaction of photons with living matter[br/]2. Tissue optics: light propagation in biological tissues and light dosimetry[br/]3. Photophysics of large molecules[br/]4. Photochemistry: reactions and products[br/]5. Photobiology: from the cell to the clinic[br/]6. Photodetection of early lesions with exogenous and endogenous dyes[br/]7. Established and novel therapies in photomedicine
free_text.Keywords: Tissue optics, photobiology, tissue optical spectroscopy and imaging, photosensitizers
